qas.question: How did Panama's department stores originally begin?
When did Panama's Department stores first start?

answers.text: at the turn of the nineteenth century

qas.question: What department store is often called "Felix" by the local population?
What store has managed to survive despite much it's competition going under?
How did Panama's department stores originally end?
How didn't Panama's department stores originally begin?

plausible_answers.text: at the turn of the nineteenth century

qas.question: When did Panama's Department stores first end?
What department store is never called "Felix" by the local population?
What store has managed to close despite much it's competition thriving?

context: Panama's first department stores such as Bazaar Francés, La Dalia and La Villa de Paris started <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>as textile retailers<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> <a1_0><b6_0>at the turn of the nineteenth century<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Later on in the twentieth century these eventually gave way to stores such as Felix B. Maduro, Sarah Panamá, Figali, Danté, Sears, Gran Morrison and smaller ones such as Bon Bini, Cocos, El Lider, Piccolo and Clubman among others. Of these only <a2_0><b7_0>Felix B. Maduro<b7_0/><a2_0/> (usually referred to as Felix by locals) and Danté remain strong. All the others have either folded or declined although <a3_0><b8_0>Cocos<b8_0/><a3_0/> has managed to secure a good position in the market.
